message.content: This question requires basic knowledge of physical changes and the properties of paper. When a paper is ripped in half, it alters the shape of the paper, creating two separate pieces. Option (B) is incorrect because ripping the paper changes its physical state. Option (C) is incorrect because ripping the paper does not enlarge it. Option (D) is incorrect because ripping the paper does not change it into a gas form.
